sen.j: 聖戒（じょうかい、生没年不詳）は、鎌倉時代中期の時宗歓喜光寺の僧。
sen.e: Jokai (date of birth and death unknown) is a priest of Kankiko-ji Temple of Jishu sect in the mid Kamakura period.
Jokai (date of birth and death unknown) is a monk of Kankiko-ji Temple of the Jishu Sect during the mid Kamakura period.
Jokai (year of birth and death unknown) is a priest of Kankiko-ji Temple of the Jishu Sect during the mid Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 生没年不詳date を year に修正しました。monk を priest に修正しました。

sen.j: 伊予国の領主河野通広の孫で、一遍の従弟（一説には弟または甥）。
sen.e: He was a grandson of Michihiro KONO, the feudal lord of Iyo Province, and a cousin (or brother or nephew according to another theory) of Ippen.
He was a grandson of Michihiro KONO, the feudal lord of the Iyo Province, and a cousin (also rumored to be a brother or a nephew) of Ippen.
He was a grandson of Michihiro KONO, the feudal lord of Iyo Province, and a cousin (also rumored to be a brother or a nephew) of Ippen.
sen.cmt: the Iyo Province の the を削除しました。

sen.j: 一遍の弟子他阿真教の徒弟として、正応4年（1291年）に京都錦小路通に歓喜光寺を建てた。
sen.e: As an apprentice of Taa, a disciple of Ippen, Jokai built the Kankiko-ji Temple on the Nishikikoji-dori Street, Kyoto, in 1291.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文は「他阿真教」となっていますが、一遍の弟子は「他阿」なのでTaaと訳しました。
sen.e: As an apprentice of Taa, who was a disciple of Ippen, Jokai built the Kankiko-ji Temple along the Nishikikoji-dori Street, Kyoto, in 1291.
As an apprentice of Taa, who was a disciple of Ippen, Jokai built the Kankiko-ji Temple along the Nishikikoji-dori Street, Kyoto, in 1291.

sen.j: 時宗十二派中の一つである六条派の祖となった。
sen.e: He became the founder of one of twelve schools of Jishu sect, Rokujo school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He became the Founder of the Rokujo School, which is one of the Twelve Schools of the Jishu Sect.
He became the Founder of the Rokujo School, which is one of the Twelve Schools of the Jishu Sect.

sen.j: 正安元年（1299年）には『一遍上人絵伝』12巻を撰し、法眼円伊にこれを描かせた。
sen.e: In 1299, he edited twelve-scroll "Ippen Shonin Eden" (Illustrated Biography of the priest Ippen) and asked Hogen (the second highest rank for Buddhist priests) Eni to draw pictures for the scroll.

In 1299, Jokai edited the Twelve-Scrolls of "Ippen Shonin Eden" (the Illustrated Biography of Ippen), and requested Hogen (the second highest rank for Buddhist monks) Eni to draw illustrations for the scroll.

In 1299, Jokai edited the Twelve-Scrolls of "Ippen Shonin Eden" (the Illustrated Biography of Ippen), and requested Hogen (the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) Eni to draw illustrations for the scroll.
sen.cmt: 法眼(the second highest rank for Buddhist monks) を(the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) に修正しました。

sen.j: これが『六条縁起』である。
sen.e: This biography is also known as "Rokujo Engi."
